name: Gnar
title: the Missing Link
lore: Gnar is a primeval yordle whose playful antics can erupt into a toddler's outrage in an instant, transforming him into a massive beast bent on destruction. Frozen in True Ice for millennia, the curious creature broke free and now hops about a changed world he sees as exotic and wondrous. Delighted by danger, Gnar flings whatever he can at his enemies, be it his bonetooth boomerang, or a nearby building.
blurb: Gnar is a primeval yordle whose playful antics can erupt into a toddler's outrage in an instant, transforming him into a massive beast bent on destruction. Frozen in True Ice for millennia, the curious creature broke free and now hops about a changed...
allytips: Managing your Rage is very important. Try to time out your transformations so you can get maximum benefit from both forms.
Position yourself next to walls to bait your enemies into getting stunned by your ultimate.
Know your strengths! Mini Gnar is fast, squishy, and has high sustained damage. Mega Gnar is slow, tough, and has high burst.
enemytips: Gnar can't gain Rage for 15 seconds after he turns from big to little. Use this chance to engage on his team.
Gnar's animations and resource bar change as he gets closer to transforming.
Gnar's ultimate stuns if he hits you into a wall. Be careful when fighting him near one.

riot_spells.name: Boomerang Throw / Boulder Toss
riot_spells.description:
Gnar throws a boomerang that damages and slows enemies it hits before returning to him. If he catches the boomerang its cooldown is reduced.

Mega Gnar instead throws a boulder that stops on the first unit hit, damaging and slowing everything nearby. It can then be picked up to reduce the cooldown.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Mini Gnar: Throws a boomerang that deals {{ minitotaldamage }} physical damage and slows enemies by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds. The boomerang returns towards Gnar after hitting an enemy, dealing {{ minisubsequentmult*100 }}% damage to subsequent targets. Each enemy can only be hit once. Catching the boomerang reduces its cooldown by {{ minicdrefund*100 }}%.

Mega Gnar: Throws a boulder that stops when it hits an enemy, slowing all nearby enemies and dealing {{ megatotaldamage }} physical damage. Picking up the boulder reduces its cooldown by {{ megacdrefund*100 }}%.

riot_spells.name: Hyper / Wallop
riot_spells.description:
Gnar's attacks and spells hype him up, dealing bonus damage and granting him Movement Speed.

Mega Gnar is too enraged to be hyper and instead can rear up on his hind legs and smash down on the area in front of him, stunning enemies in an area.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Mini Gnar: Passive: Every 3rd attack or spell on the same target deals an additional {{ minitotaldamage }} +{{ minipercenthpdamage*100 }}% of the target's max Health as magic damage and grants Gnar {{ f1 }}% Movement Speed that decays over 3 seconds (max {{ minimonstercap }} damage vs. monsters).

Mega Gnar: Stuns enemies in an area for {{ megastunduration }} seconds, dealing {{ megatotaldamage }} physical damage.

Gnar gains Hyper's Movement Speed bonus when he leaves Mega form.

riot_spells.name: Hop / Crunch
riot_spells.description:
Gnar leaps to a location and bounces off the head of any unit he lands on, traveling further.

Mega Gnar is too large to bounce and instead lands with earth-shattering force, dealing damage in an area around him.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Mini Gnar: Leaps to a location, gaining {{ minibas*100 }}% attack speed for {{ miniasduration }} seconds. If Gnar lands on a unit he will bounce off it, traveling further. Deals {{ minitotaldamage }} physical damage and slows briefly if the unit landed on was an enemy.

Mega Gnar: Leaps to a location and deals {{ megatotaldamage }} physical damage to nearby enemies on landing. Enemies Gnar lands directly on top of are slowed briefly.

If Crunch is used to transform, Gnar will still be able to bounce.

riot_spells.name: GNAR!
riot_spells.description: Mega Gnar throws everything around him in a chosen direction, dealing damage and slowing them.  Any enemy that hits a wall is stunned and takes bonus damage.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Mini Gnar: Passive: Increases Hyper's Movement Speed bonus to {{ rhypermovementspeedpercent }}%.

Mega Gnar: Knocks nearby enemies in the specified direction, dealing {{ damage }} physical damage and slowing them by {{ rslowpercent }}% for {{ rccduration }} seconds. Enemies that hit a wall take {{ rwallhitdamagemultiplier }}% damage and are stunned instead of slowed.

riot_passive.name: Rage Gene
riot_passive.description: While in combat Gnar generates Rage. At maximum Rage his next ability will transform him into Mega Gnar, granting increased survivability and access to new spells.

i1.name: Rage Gene
i1.blurb: While in combat Gnar generates Rage. At maximum Rage his next ability will transform him into Mega Gnar, granting increased survivability and access to new spells.
i1.description: {{sbc|{{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}}:}} While in '''Mini Gnar''' form, he gains '''bonus''' {{sti|ms|{{as|movement speed}}}}, {{sti|range|attack range}}, {{as|attack speed growth}} and {{sti|{{as|attack speed}}}}.
i1.leveling: {{st|Bonus Movespeed|{{pp|10 to 24;26;28;30|displayformula=9 + 1 per level up to 15, then + 2 per level}}|Total Movespeed|{{pp|335 to 349;351;353;355|displayformula=334 + 1 per level up to 15, then + 2 per level}}}}{{st|Bonus Range|{{pp|225 to 325}}|Total Range|{{pp|175+225 to 175+325}}}}
i1.description2: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Mini Gnar''' generates {{pp|3|4 to 11|1 to 11}} ''{{ai|Rage Gene|Gnar|Rage}}'' over 2 seconds upon dealing or receiving [[damage]]. Against non-[[champion]]s, basic attacks and {{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}} instantly generate {{pp|3|0.5;0.875;1.375|1 to 11}} ''Rage''. Against champions, {{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}} instantly generates {{pp|3|1;1.75;2.75|1 to 11}} ''Rage'', and basic attacks instantly generate {{pp|3|2;3.5;5.5|1 to 11}}. {{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}} can only generate ''Rage'' once per cast, and grants ''Rage'' based on the first enemy hit. '''Gnar's''' ''Rage'' decays if he has not dealt or taken damage in the last 13 seconds.
i1.description3: At maximum ''{{ai|Rage Gene 2|Gnar|Rage}}'', casting an ability or after 4 seconds will ''{{ai|Rage Gene 3|Gnar|transform}}'' him into {{ci|Mega Gnar}} for 15 seconds, during which '''Gnar's''' ''Rage'' depletes. Afterwards '''Gnar''' returns to '''Mini Gnar''' and is too ''{{ai|Rage Gene 4|Gnar|tired}}'' to generate ''Rage'' for 15 seconds. '''Gnar''' retains his {{sti|health|{{as|current '''percentage''' health}}}} when he returns to '''Mini Gnar'''.
i1.description4: {{sbc|{{ci|Mega Gnar}}:}} '''Mega Gnar''' has different abilities, although they share ''Mini Gnar's'' ability cooldowns. While in '''Mega Gnar''' form, he loses all '''Mini Gnar's''' buffs and instead has increased {{sti|ad|{{as|'''base''' AD}}}}, {{sti|health|{{as|'''base''' health}}}}, {{sti|armor|{{as|'''base''' armor}}}}, and {{sti|mr|{{as|'''base''' magic resistance}}}}. '''Gnar''' [[healing|restores]] {{sti|{{as|health}}}} equal to the increase.
i1.notes:
* The ''Rage'' generated upon dealing or receiving damage occurs over 2 seconds with 4 ticks every {{fd|0.5}} seconds. It also does not stack but instead refreshes with subsequent applications (of dealing or receiving damage).
* The bonus rage generation on basic attacks counts as an on-hit effect, and is triggered by {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}} and {{ii|Guinsoo's Rageblade}}.
* Against non-champions, basic attacks and {{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}} instantly generate '''{{fd|12.5}}%''' of the ''Rage'' over time. While, against champions, {{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}} instantly generates '''25%''', and basic attacks '''50%'''.
* In-game, the value on the ''Rage'' bar always displays rounded down to the nearest integer.
* {{cis|Mega Gnar}} gained health is not affected by {{tip|Grievous Wounds}} or increased healing from items and runes.
* When returning to {{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}}, ''Gnar'' will only retain his current health percentage, not current health total.
** This is intentional to prevent Gnar from simply triggering ''Rage Gene'' in order to heal himself over time.
* '''Gnar's''' abilities share cooldowns across forms.
* The final stats, after ''Rage Gene'' being applied, can be seen on '''Gnar''' and '''Mega Gnar''' respective data template, in the [[Gnar|front page]].
** '''Mini Gnar''' gains {{pp|key=%|5.5+({{Data Gnar|pst2|as_lvl}}-{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|as_lvl}})*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1))|formula=5.5 base+{{#expr:{{Data Gnar|pst2|as_lvl}}-{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|as_lvl}}}} growth}} '''bonus''' attack speed.
** '''Mega Gnar''' gains {{pp|({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|hp_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|hp_base}})+({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|hp_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|hp_lvl}})*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1))|formula={{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|hp_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|hp_base}}}} base+{{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|hp_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|hp_lvl}}}} growth}} base health, {{pp|({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|arm_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|arm_base}})+({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|arm_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|arm_lvl}})*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1))|formula={{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|arm_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|arm_base}}}} base+{{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|arm_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|arm_lvl}}}} growth}} base armor, {{pp|({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|mr_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|mr_base}})+({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|mr_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|mr_lvl}})*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1))|formula={{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|mr_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|mr_base}}}} base+{{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|mr_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|mr_lvl}}}} growth}} base magic resistance, and {{pp|({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|dam_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|dam_base}})+({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|dam_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|dam_lvl}})*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1))|formula={{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|dam_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|dam_base}}}} base+{{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|dam_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|dam_lvl}}}} growth}} base attack damage.

q1.name: Boomerang Throw
q1.blurb: Gnar throws a boomerang that damages and slows enemies it hits before returning to him. If he catches the boomerang its cooldown is reduced.
q1.description: {{sbc|{{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}} - Active:}} '''Gnar''' throws a boomerang forward in a line that deals {{tip|physical damage|{{as|physical damage}}}} and {{tip|slow|slows}} enemies for 2 seconds. The boomerang returns towards '''Gnar''' in a fixed line after reaching its maximum range or hitting an enemy, dealing 50% damage to subsequent targets.
q1.leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|5 to 165}} {{as|(+ 115% AD)}}|Reduced Damage|{{ap|5/2 to 165/2}} {{as|(+ {{fd|57.5}}% AD)}}}}{{st|Slow|{{ap|15 to 35}}%}}
q1.description2: Each enemy can only be hit once. Catching the boomerang while in mid-air refunds 40% of its {{sti|cooldown|maximum cooldown}}, while if caught at the end of its return flight it refunds completely.
q1.notes:
* The boomerang return direction is determined by which direction '''Gnar''' is heading, similar to {{cai|Spinning Axe|Draven}}, and is calculated at the apex of its flight.
* Since the cooldown between the two is shared ''Mini Gnar'' may pick up a boulder and/or ''Mega Gnar'' may catch a boomerang.
* Using ''Boomerang Throw'' during {{ai|Hop|Gnar}} will cause the boomerang to travel 1100 units from the destination where '''Gnar''' jumped.
** As a result the boomerang animation glitches slightly in height.

q2.name: Boulder Toss
q2.blurb: Mega Gnar instead throws a boulder that stops on the first unit hit, damaging and slowing everything nearby. It can then be picked up to reduce the cooldown.
q2.description: {{sbc|{{ci|Mega Gnar}} - Active:}} '''Gnar''' throws a boulder that stops when it hits an enemy, applying {{ais|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}} {{tip|slow}} to all nearby enemies and dealing {{as|physical damage}}.
q2.description2: '''Gnar''' can pick up the boulder by moving within 90 units of it, refunding 60% of its {{sti|cooldown|maximum cooldown}}.
q2.notes:
* Since the cooldown between the two is shared ''Mini Gnar'' may pick up a boulder and/or ''Mega Gnar'' may catch a boomerang.
* Gnar is locked out of picking up his boulder for {{fd|0.3}} seconds after throwing it.
* The {{ai|Boulder Toss|Gnar|Boulder}} will stop if colliding with {{ai|Wind Wall|Yasuo}} or {{ai|Unbreakable|Braum}}.

w2.name: Wallop
w2.blurb: Mega Gnar is too enraged to be hyper and instead can rear up on his hind legs and smash down on the area in front of him, stunning enemies in an area.
w2.description: {{sbc|{{ci|Mega Gnar}} - Active:}} '''Gnar''' slams in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to all enemies struck and {{tip|stun|stunning}} them for {{fd|1.25}} seconds.

w1.name: Hyper
w1.blurb: Gnar's attacks and spells hype him up, dealing bonus damage and granting him Movement Speed.
w1.description: {{sbc|{{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}} - Passive:}} Every {{ai|Hyper 2|Gnar|third}} attack or ability on the same target within {{fd|3.5}} seconds deals {{tip|magic damage|{{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}}} (capped against monsters) and grants '''Gnar''' {{pp|type = [[File:GNAR!.png|20px|border]] GNAR!'s rank|4|key=%|30 to 75|0 to 3|displayformula = 30%+15% per GNAR!'s rank|color=ms}} {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} that decays over 3 seconds.
w1.leveling: {{st|Bonus Magic Damage|{{ap|10 to 50}} {{as|(+ {{ap|6 to 14}}% of target's '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|(+ 100% AP)}}|Maximum Bonus Damage To Monsters|{{ap|100 to 300}} {{as|(+ 100% AP)}}}}
w1.description2: '''Gnar''' gains ''Hyper's'' {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} when he leaves {{ci|Mega Gnar|Mega}} form.

e2.name: Crunch
e2.blurb: Mega Gnar is too large to bounce and instead lands with earth-shattering force, dealing damage in an area around him.
e2.description: {{sbc|{{ci|Mega Gnar}} - Active:}} '''Gnar''' {{tip|dash|leaps}} to a target location and deals ''Hop's'' damage to nearby enemies on landing.
e2.description2: {{sbc|Hop and Crunch:}} If ''Crunch'' is used to transform, '''Gnar''' will still be able to {{tip|dash|bounce}}. ''Crunch's'' area of effect is dealt in both areas, though enemies can only be damaged once.
e2.description3: Enemies '''Gnar''' lands directly on top of are dealt ''Hop's'' {{tip|slow}}.
e2.notes: * ''Gnar'' is locked out of using any other abilities during ''Crunch'', but he can still transform mid-air if he reaches 100 ''Rage'' during the jump of ''Hop''.

e1.name: Hop
e1.blurb: Gnar leaps to a location and bounces off the head of any unit he lands on, traveling further.
e1.description: {{sbc|{{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}} - Active:}} '''Gnar''' {{tip|dash|leaps}} to a target location, gaining {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' attack speed}}}} for 3 seconds.
e1.description2: If '''Gnar''' lands on a unit he will {{tip|dash|bounce}} 525 units further in the same direction.
e1.description3: Landing on an enemy deals {{as|physical damage}} and {{tip|slow|slows}} it by 80% for {{fd|0.5}} seconds.
e1.notes: * ''Hop'' does not allow ''Gnar'' to bounce off wards.

r1.name: GNAR!
r1.blurb: Mega Gnar throws everything around him in a chosen direction, dealing damage and slowing them. Any enemy that hits a wall is stunned and takes bonus damage.
r1.description2: {{sbc|{{ci|Mega Gnar}} - Active:}} After {{fd|0.4}}-seconds, '''Gnar''' {{tip|airborne|knocks}} nearby enemies up to 590 units in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 45%.
r1.leveling2: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|200 to 400}} {{as|(+ 20% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ 50% AP)}}|Increased Damage|{{ap|200*1.5 to 400*1.5}} {{as|(+ 30% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ 75% AP)}}}}
r1.description3: Enemies that hit a wall take 50% '''bonus''' damage and are {{tip|stun|stunned}} instead of {{tip|slow|slowed}}.
r1.notes: * ''GNAR!'s active'' also stuns enemies hitting impassable player-created terrain ({{ai|Crystallize|Anivia}}, {{ai|Emperor's Divide|Azir}}, {{ai|Cataclysm|Jarvan IV}}, {{ai|Pillar of Ice|Trundle}}).
